thread.title: One college football expert has Northwestern playing in the College Football Playoff
thread.title_full: One college football expert has Northwestern playing in the College Football Playoff | Chicago Sun-Times

title: One college football expert has Northwestern playing in the College Football Playoff
text:
The Northwestern fan base may not be as loud or recognizable as some of the schools in the SEC, but one longtime college football expert has the Wildcats doing something that no one in the SEC will.
Yahoo’s Pat Forde released his College Football Playoff bracket , as he does every week, but Monday’s included a big surprise. Forde has Northwestern as the No. 2 seed in the CFP.
According to Forde, if the playoffs were to start this week, Northwestern would play Florida in the Orange Bowl for the right to move on to the national championship game.
Pat Forde :
Northwestern’s defense has been impenetrable, leading the nation in fewest points allowed per game at seven. Opponents have made 10 trips into the red zone against Northwestern and only scored one touchdown. Next up for Pat Fitzgerald’s team is a game that has rocketed up the Intrigue Scale: at Michigan on Saturday.
Forde puts a huge emphasis on Northwestern’s wins against Stanford and Duke, the lone loss on the year for both schools.
Joining Northwestern and Florida, according to Forde, is fellow surprise team Utah at No. 1 and No. 4 Baylor.
Forde has the likes of TCU, Ohio State, Michigan State and Texas A&M among those considered for a playoff spot.
Northwestern jumped up in the AP and Coaches Poll rankings. They are now ranked No. 13 and No. 14 in each poll, respectively.
